name: pyrinoline
source: Bergstrom C. A. S.; Norinder U.; Luthman K.; Artursson P. Molecular Descriptors Influencing Melting Point and Their Role in Classification of Solid Drugs. J. Chem. Inf. Comput. Sci.; (Article); 2003; 43(4); 1177-1432
Reason: 1-ethylpiperazine-2,3-dione base, with a melting point around 106 degrees Celsius, based on the presence of two carbonyl groups, which can participate in dipole interactions and rigidify the structure, estimated at around +20 degrees Celsius for each carbonyl. The piperidine ring (N1CCCC1) and 1-ethyl-4-methylenepiperidine moiety may both add roughly +20 each due to adding more rigid ring structures and making the molecule more compact. The methyl group (C1) introduces a small increase due to the additional molecular weight and possible hydrogen bonding, estimated at around +2 degrees Celsius.
